title: Newtons third law - student pushing on wall

content.question: A student pushes a wall with a force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub student on wall, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>s-w</mtext></msub></math>. The wall exerts a force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub wall on student, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>w-s</mtext></msub></math> on the student. The student then pushes harder on the wall, exerting a force of magnitude <math alttext="2 F sub student on wall, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>s-w</mtext></msub></math> on the wall. The magnitude of the force that the wall then exerts on the student is

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator F sub wall on student, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>w-s</mtext></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="F sub wall on student, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>w-s</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="2 F sub wall on student, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>w-s</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="4 F sub wall on student, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>w-s</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 F sub wall on student, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>w-s</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
